Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel Stay This hotel was certainly not what it was advertised to be. The first room they placed us in was a dark dingy room with a broken plasma tv that they hooked with wires into a portable television. The concierge charged us double for booking museum tickets While at the buffet, someone took our table and was extremely rude when we returned. The Management did nothing. As we were checking out, we asked them to call a taxi. The doorman took our bags and placed them in the taxi knowing that the taxi would start the meter. When I discovered the taxi meter had started before we checked out, the doorman just walked away and did nothing.This was part of our Honeymoon trip. We could not have asked for worse. This was certainly not a leading hotel as they state!
Reviews.Author: sundevil88

Reviews.Content: loved the room and the breakfast A very nice room 241 overlooking a garden ,and a wonderfull breakfast near the swimming pool with many fruit ,people very kind especially the night porter very helpfull for finding place for the next day great location great hotel.
Reviews.Author: ItalyDianat

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Wonderful It is within walking distance from the shopping, 3 blocks from the river yet when you are inside you are no longer in the hectic city. Walking into the hotel you are now in a very relaxing atmosphere. It is the only hotel in Florence with a pool which sits in the garden. The restaurant is located in that area. We had breakfast outside overlooking the pool daily.the staff is extremely helpful and very courteous. The room had a beautiful terrance with lounge chairs and it overlooked the Duomo. WOW, What a view.I would recommend this hotel for honeymooners as well as a family with children.
Reviews.Author: JosieBoop

Reviews.Content: A wonderful old grand villa. We have just returned from Italy and spent 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. Its position is great, 10 minutes walk from the old town. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff at this hotel. It was spotless, even though we never saw a cleaner. The pool attendant put out fresh towels for guests every day and the waiters looked after our every need. As we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary we wanted somewhere special to stay and this hotel did not disappoint. The drinks were quite expensive as you expect from a deluxe hotel but apart from that it was perfect. Highly recommended, we will hopefully be going back in the future.
Reviews.Author: dlewse2

Reviews.Content: A Great End to Our Florence Trip My boyfriend and I stayed in Grand Hotel Villa Medici on the last night of a 5 day trip to Florence. As others have commented, it was expensive (too expensive for us to stay more than one night) but the experience was worth it.The staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. In particular, we were able to check in at 10am rather than the stated 2pm.One of the main reasons I booked this hotel was for the swimming pool. It was busy in the morning but later in the afternoon there were free sun beds and it was nice to be able to cool off and relax in the hotel garden.We stayed in one of the penthouse rooms - the view over the city was great and it was very relaxing being able to sit on the balcony for a couple of hours before dinner with a beer and some olives (from a nearby supermarket - the mini bar was VERY expensive!)We had dinner in the Conservatory Restaurant and the food was delicious, the best I had in Florence. It was fairly expensive but not ridiculously so, given that I found even average food and drink to be expensive everywhere in Florence.I would recommend Grand Hotel Villa Medici.
Reviews.Author: Clairyj

Reviews.Content: Over Rated  At 670 EUROS per night one would not expect to find stained carpets, used Band-Aids on the floor upon arrival, a bathtub that filled with black water, dead plants in the flower boxes, raggedy upholstery, terrible cutlery and service equipment, etc., etc. We booked a penthouse room which in their adverts looked like it would have a rooftop terrace jacuzzi but found out that what we got was a whirlpool bathtub. Also, two drinks at the bar cost 27 EUROS. WiFi available at additional cost. I feel like a real sucker for having this room. A friend of mine stayed At the NH Anglo American Hotel at the same time as I was there and paid 115 EURO for a larger, cleaner room than I have. Two blocks from where the Villa Medici is. Go figuer.
Reviews.Author: mastersmate

Reviews.Content: Unbeatable Hotel Villa Medici Something is definitely not right here- don't you believe that there are over 100 more popular hotels in Florence - Grand Hotel Villa Medici should be up there in the top 10.This hotel made our holiday in Florence- beautiful, bright, airy and spotlessly clean. Gorgeous room with balcony looking out onto the Duomo - the memory of drawing back the curtains in the morning to that sight will never leave my mind. Everyone we came across was warm and friendly and in the heat of August, to come back to the quiet of the gardens and the beautiful swimming pool was heaven. I trawled through tripadvisor and read dozens of reviews searching for a hotel near the centre of Florence that had an outdoor swimming pool and that was my main reason in deciding to book in here.Yes, as others have remarked, it is expensive, but you can trust that, unlike so many other expensive hotels, you do get what you pay for here .... and more. We booked accommodation only, but on showing us to our rooms, the duty manager Matteo informed us that they were including breakfast.for theduration of our stay. This for four people for six nights... Just like that! We have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels in Europe and with the exception of one hotel in Paris, have never been treated to a freebie.! I couldn't ever imagine staying anywhere else when we return to Florence,and hopefully, that return visit will be soon. Wonderful memories of beautiful Florence and Villa Medici.
Reviews.Author: windsweptIreland

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel Just returned from ten days in Florence and Rome. This hotel was our first stop. The rooms were clean and spacious and we had a lovely view of the garden, mind you it wasn't cheap! On arrival we received mixed advice about parking our hire car . It transpired that if the hotel parks the car for you in the municipal car park opposite then you pay twice as much as if you park it yourself. When checking on the type of breakfast available, we were told that it wasn't included in our booking and that it would cost 30 euros each! Although I had a print out of our reservation it didn't mention breakfast. I knew it was included and it took a lot of chasing for them to accept we were correct. It wasn't even that good and certainly not worth 30.Sitting in the garden by the pool was very relaxing and the lovely lady on lifeguard duty was always quick to ensure everyone had a comfortable sunbed, nothing was too much trouble for her!The position of the hotel suited us, it was a 15 minute walk to the centre, but it was fairly quiet at the end of a busy day sightseeing.Overall, a very nice place to stay!
Reviews.Author: cookiecrewBathUK

Reviews.Content: Truly Memorable Stay Belated review- Stayed here with my parents for 4 nights back in April. I booked through AMEX Platinum's Fine Hotels program. Maybe that was the reason, or maybe the hotel service is always this excellent, but we were treated like VIPs throughout our stay. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a 5th-floor deluxe suite, with a welcome platter of fresh fruit and a bottle of wine awaiting our entry. The room was beautifully appointed with traditional decor. Large comfy bed, luxurious curtains, even a tapestry! Separate bedroom and sitting area with a TV in each, and a balcony with a view of the Duomo and the Palazzo Vecchio. The room was not soundproofed, but I have yet to come across a hotel room in Italy that is. Also, the bathroom exhibited a slightly funky odor, but was otherwise functional and spacious. So overall, the suite was gorgeous and comfortable with only a couple of minor inconveniences.As for the hotel itself, the common areas are a stylish blend of past and present. There's a lovely courtyard with a swimming pool, and adjacent to that is the Conservatory restaurant. The breakfast buffet is average, but definitely have dinner here if you can! Best Italian meal I've ever had, hands down. Even a place like Babbo's in NY doesn't compare. Of course, it probably helped that we went on an off-season weeknight and were essentially treated to a private dinner. Still, wow.Location: As others have written, the hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from most city attractions. But it's located in a relatively quiet neighborhood. Plus it's very close to the SMN bus/train terminal, which is convenient for day excursions to Siena and other Tuscan towns, or for arrivals/departures via Eurostar.Finally, it's worth noting that Travel  Leisure magazine just ranked the Grand Hotel Villa Medici 35th in all of Europe. That's better than any other Fiorentine hotel. Considering that the place doesn't seem to be as well-known as some of its neighbors (yet), this means that we're looking at a hidden gem.
Reviews.Author: Dartmouth06

Reviews.Content: really nice I booked a penthouse room. The view from the terrace was wonderful, you could see the Duomo and the Palazzo Vecchio tower and all the mountains surrounding the city. The room itself was very traditional and comfortable and the bathroom was marble, (although could do with a little tlc, our shower screen didn't seal and therefore water leaked onto the floor). The jacuzzi bath was great after a long day walking around sightseeing. The staff were very polite. The breakfast buffet was fine, although on the second day I had to wait 25 minutes and ask 4 times for a coffee whilst the staff sat around chatting! Location was perfect! 15minute stroll to the ponte vecchio and the same to the Duomo. Even if you didn't book a penthouse room, i noticed that there was a roof terrace with tables that you could've sat and enjoyed your drinks and the views on. Not the best hotel I've stayed in but overall a great experience, I would definately return.
Reviews.Author: hollyworld88

Reviews.Content: INCREDIBLE Hotel!! My 20 year old daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days and loved everything about it! I lived in Italy for a while and she was also living there at the time, so we wanted a hotel that authentically reflected Florence and Europe. We definitely got more than we paid for!The hotel is the perfect distance away from the hoards of tourists, and is in a quiet (for Florence), upscale neighborhood.Our room was huge and beautiful, with a balcony that overlooked the pool and the city. We sat on the balcony and gazed at the Duomo every day. The church bells rang in the distance -- just far enough away to be charming.The staff was wonderful, always willing to help! With their guidance we were able to avoid long lines and visited incredible restaurants in the neighborhood.If you want a hotel that is close to all the attractions, but away from the crowds and the Arno River, this is THE place to stay! This is the best, and only, hotel for us in Florence!
Reviews.Author: Travelgal5

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel A fantastic hotel The staff could not have been more gracious and helpful. We had a room that smelled of smoke on our first night and they fell over themselves to change our room to a non smoking room. We ate at the restuarant for the first night and the food was exceptional, as was breakfast. A1 hotel.
Reviews.Author: Yeovil1

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Rooms! My husband and I recently stayed at the Villa Medici and we were very impressed! We drove to Florence, so driving-wise it was perfect - there was a big parking lot out front that wasn't too pricey to park in for the night. The hotel itself is about a 7 minute walk to the Duomo, and parts of the walk at night did look a little sketchy... but it turned out to be fine. The rooms were absolutely beautiful and spotless - there was plenty of room, had a flatscreen TV, terrace, large marble bathroom... It was pricey, but compared to other hotels in Italy, you got your money's worth. The staff was very nice and helpful as well.
Reviews.Author: elynnw

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay Perfect location away from the traffic noise.In walking distance of the main shopping area.Staff were wonderful and our room on the 5th floor had a magnificent view of the city. It also had a balcony with loungers so one could relax on the patio.Gorgeous patio downstairs outside for dining and lounge bar attached.Room was quiet .Can't wait to return.
Reviews.Author: hotel1809

Reviews.Content: A really lovely stay A travel agent booked two nights at the Villa Medici during a weeklong tour through Tuscany (the first and last nights of the trip). After reading reviews on tripadvisor, I was regretting the decision. However, we were delighted when we arrived at the hotel. The staff made an effort to have a room ready for us when we arrived at 11am after a red-eye transatlantic flight. The room was modern with plenty of space and a large marble bathroom. Another room at the end of our trip was virtually identical. The concierge Paolo (so nice) made reservations for us at the Accademia and recommended a couple of local restaurants (some better than others). We didn't swim in the pool but we did read our books in the pool area--very nice. Breakfast had a wide selection and the cappucino was delicious. We ate on the terrace with views of the Duomo. The biggest down side was that the hotel is a bit far from the city's center--about a 10 minute walk--but the plus side is that it is very quiet at night for sleeping.
Reviews.Author: DocmomBoston_MA

Reviews.Content: The Real Best Hotel In Florence I really think that this is the best Hotel in Florence, for the great Service, nice and quiet location , and the wonderfull facilities like a real swimming pool and very nice wellness club,with small but complete gym, Sauna and Hammam.The rooms are very nice nice and well renovated.The staff was very friendly and happy to work there. Not like in American management's Hotels like Starwood or other things...Sorry for my English but is not my language.
Reviews.Author: THECROW21

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Just stayed with family and had a very nice time. Staff are knowledgeable and helpful, rooms are stylish, and the pool although small is quite nice after a day of touring. The only negatives are that the location is slightly removed from the sights and the beds are NOT very comfortable.
Reviews.Author: mdski

Reviews.Content: Nice, but not 5 star We stayed at the Villa Medici last week. It was clean and the staff was friendly, but it is absolutely not a 5 star hotel. The facility is very outdated. Our cold water did not work for the last two days of our stay. We had to shower in an empty room. The wellness centerhad a home style treadmil, stationary bike, and Climber, essentially that was all. We happened to stay one night at the Montebello Splendid, around the corner, due to my mistake with our reservation. It was an amazing hotel at a similar price point.
Reviews.Author: fscibelli

Reviews.Content: excellent hotel , nice staff Villa de Medici is a very nice hotel with big rooms and a nice very helfull staff . Even the restaurant is well above average and one of the few example that hotels can indeed have a very good kitchen and service. The only real disappointment was breakfast. You may think that for what they charge (more then 30 euros) you get outstanding food. But the cooked ham would barely make it on a pizza and also the other food and cut meats / bread hardly meet the quality this hotel otherwise shows.we'll get back there but I guess we will go get breakfast somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: scoi00

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in Florence Conveniently located, beautiful hotel with a swimming pool in walking distance to all the major sites in Florence, what more can you ask for?
Reviews.Author: ToddSanFrancisco

Reviews.Content: Terrible service, overpriced This is a beautiful hotel but the staff was so rude it ruined the stay there. There is a definite communication problem with them. I would not recommend them to anyone.
Reviews.Author: AnnTexas

Reviews.Content: Five Star Price, Two Star Value We booked this hotel in Florence because I am a member of the Leading Hotels of the World. We booked a deluxe room with a view and when we checked in, it had a view but it was on a very busy street just down from the bus station where all the buses leaving Florence came by. We had to change rooms immediately because you could not stand out on the balcony for the noise. I knew that it would be impossible to sleep at night. The concierge told us that it got quiet after 1 a.m. So if you do not go to bed till after 1 a.m., then that would be fine.We booked a package that included dinner. My husband and I could barely make it through the four course dinner before wanting to run out the door and look for a piece of pizza. The dinner was 175 Euro if you were paying for it and which we were as we paid extra to stay at this hotel because we had anticipated a wonderful, romatic dinner and did not mind paying a little more for this hotel. Save your money. Not only was the dinner horrible, the breakfast was just as bad. They served Tang (a powdered orange drink) for breakfast. The staff in the restaurant always acted disorganized and confused and when we showed up for our dinner reservation, there was nobody there to greet you. Now I understand why---smart people do not eat there.The room we were put in only had one pillow on each bed, no extra blankets, the toilet ran all the time, there was never a newspaper on the door in the morning, and the hotel all in all was not a beautiful facility. It is on a corner and is very plain from the outside and inside. So, like my title said, a five star price for two star service.
Reviews.Author: Kakiebell

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel but not a beautiful stay! This hotel j has been beautifuly renovated since I first stayed there 5 years ago.The hotel has combined the beauty of an old palace with just the right contemporary touches. Despite the beauty, the hotel is missing on service and some major details that should not be overlooked, especialy when toting a 5 star rating.I booked a deluxe room and was given a very small room with no view. I asked if there was anoteher room availabele with a view, and I was told that my room met the deluxe criteria . The weather was also extremely warm for April, 85 degrees during the day. I asked for air conditiining and I was told that it could not be turned on at this date. However, two nights into my 6 night saty the air conditioning was turned on , due to an overbearing amount of guest complaints. Despite this, The AC in my specific room was not working . Each time I inquired about this, the hotel sent up an engineer who tlld me to wait 10 minutes after they tampered with it. Despite a very strange noise coming from the vents, i was told that it would begin to work. This never happened, and i was still denied a room change. Finally, i was able to show the managemnet that a colleague's room was much cooler . At this point, they agreed to change my room on my 4th night there.In addition, the synthetic pillows were unbearable to sleep on( Iiwent to the COOP and bought one fro 9 euros for my use), Tood bad, as this is a beautiful hotel. A little far from the town center, but a healthy and pleasant 25 minute walk in good weather,
Reviews.Author: tessaNYC

Reviews.Content: Truly Five Star *****       Gardens
Reviews.Author: Mosspm

Reviews.Content: A fine hotel Stayed here for two nights. On arrival we were shown to an upgraded room. This had the most amazing bathroom, all in marble, but the room itself had no view, overlooking a courtyard. We couldn't be bothered to ask for an alternative, although on reflection, we should have done. The room itself was faultless, with fine linen sheets and every comfort. Hotel facilities were great, although when we were there, the bar and lounge were deserted every evening. Seemed like everyone was there on a package deal and spent their money outside of the hotel.We booked a deal on a website and paid 217 euros (about 288 USD) a night, that was for 2 persons including breakfast. The hotel is about ten minutes walk to the railway station, and about twenty minutes walk from the Centre.The pool wasn't open when we were there, but it would be a delight in the heat of the summer. Just ask for a room with a view...
Reviews.Author: Prosecco_please

Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! I stayed at this hotel early November. This is a more expensive hotel than I would usually stay at but my traveling buddy was weary of my budget hotels. We arrived about mid-day and she asked very nicely if there were any rooms we could upgrade to. They showed us a junior suite with sitting room (sofa that pulled out) and two full baths. It was just lovely! The concierge and staff could not have been more helpful, suggesting restaurants and when we had to change train tickets, they even went to a travel agent to have our new tickets printed. The common rooms are lovely as well, wish it had been pool weather because the pool was very inviting. The only meals we had there were breakfast which was more than adequate and included in our rate. One morning we slept through breakfast and they sent up a great continental breakfast at no extra charge. I would absolutely stay here again if I wanted a luxurious experience!
Reviews.Author: catsandroses

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, attentive staff We just celebrated our anniversary, and had a great time at Villa Medici. The hotel is located sufficiently away from the center to get some quiet, yet reasonably close to still be able to walk to everything. As part of the Leading Hotels of the World, here you get great service, but expect that to come at a higher price. We got an amazing corner room with a terrace that gave out to a view of a palazzo across the street and the pool. Fantastic concierge service. The room and bathroom were big and modern. We had dinner at the restaurant once, excellent food and service. The only disadvantage to staying here is the lack of restaurants and shops immediately around the hotel, but not much of an issue if you are willing to walk or take a taxi. In general, an excellent experience all around.
Reviews.Author: potomac-travel

Reviews.Content: wonderfull i stayed 1 night in the grand hotel villa medici in august in the suite 252 with a splendid salon.very good location, the hotel is near the city  historical center. the concierge is very sympathic and reactif. exceptionnal hotel*****
Reviews.Author: nicolartiste

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with outstanding service       Hotel lobby
Reviews.Author: pili123

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel Recently returned from a 3 night stay (July 3-5). The Villa Medici is in a very good location, close to the train station and to the Arno River. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio and maybe a little longer to the Piazza della Republica. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the pool area is also very nice. The rooms were clean with a nice sized bathroom. The buffet breakfast was also very good and complete.Where the hotel really shines is the concierge and front desk. They were very friendly and helpful with suggestions, directions and especially, restaurant recommendations. We happened to be there during the World Cup and wanted to find a last minute dinner reservation of a restaurant with a TV so we could watch the game. The concierge that evening must have called at least 6 or 7 restaurants trying to accommodate us going well out of his way. By the way, what a great, great city to be in after a World Cup win!!!All in all, a very lovely hotel with a very friendly and professional staff.P.S. The concierge recommended Trattoria Armando one evening for a real Florentine dinner. It was excellent and definitely worth a visit!!!
Reviews.Author: NYallegra

Reviews.Content: Well run hotel This is one of the few hotels in Florence with a pool, which for our family, makes it worth staying at. The pool has a well maintained garden around it, and great service.We were upgraded to the penthouse on our arrival. The room and bathroom were very new and extremely clean and we had a large balcony with a great view of Florence.Breakfast was not very good but dinner was better. The restaurant across the street from the hotel is great.The service was great and the staff friendly and helpful. The concierge booked us tickets to the Uffizi, which saved us a two hour wait on line. No complaints at all except the only two pillows on the bed were not very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Surpassed our expectations My wife and I stayed at this hotel with our nine year old son. We arrived at the hotel frustrated by a difficult overnight train from Paris exhausted and dripping with sweat from a forced march across Florence because the train in question drops you at a remote station which (unlike the one in the city centre near the hotel) is not serviced regularly by taxis. We called the hotel for assistance (which they offered) but there simply were no cabs to be had so we jumped on a city bus.The staff recognised our frustration and swung into action - ushered us to a complimentary breakfast while we awaited our room / offered changing facilities if our son wished to swim immediately and then, after a brief wait, escorted us to a huge renovated room with a thirteen foot ceiling. We were on a shopping package offered by the hotel which offered a very fair rate, a restaurant meal and a shopping tour. The concierge staff were extremely helpful in booking reservations for additional tours, gallery admissions and trains.The restaurant in the hotel was excellent. The pool area was our little oasis as temperatures approached a sweltering 37+ celsius. Service was flawless.The walk to the centre of town (or a brief cab ride) was a fair trade for the relief that the pool provided and the welcome attitude.Our experience was first class, exceeded our expectations and we will return to this property and highly recommend it to friends (especially those with children during summer heat!). This is not an inexpensive property but the prices were justified in our opinion by the service and facilities and the value surpassed other similar properties during our vacation.
Reviews.Author: Mojito82

Reviews.Content: Its OK.. but never 5 Stars As some other have said.. it needs a star or two taking off the outside walls!!Dated interior scruffy bedrooms but updated bathrooms...why didnt they complete the job and do the bedrooms at the same time...crazy (or penny-pinching).Bar area very trendy and new... no one was in it...!!Pool area nice .. water was dirty.. restaurant food ok.. breakfast dire.Not really worth the money... some trillions of lira or should I say euros need spending on this place to bring it up to scratch...a so called leading hotel of the world a very over used phrase these days.
Reviews.Author: SimonLancaster

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel The Grand Villa Medici is a very pleasant hotel and a good place to stay if you dont want to be right in the hub of Florence. My husband booked on Expedia and got a greatly reduced rate. On arrival from the station (a few blocks away but we were laden with suitcases) we were greeted by a porter who took our bags straight to reception. We were checked in quickly and taken directly to our room. The room was very nice indeed with a good size bathroom all tastefully decorated and with a lovely balcony overlooking the pool area. Breakfast was basic but sufficient. The staff were extremely helpful and arranged for us to beat the queues at The Uffizi which were about 4 hours long and gave us good recommendations for restaurants. The hotel is a 12 minute walk from the Ponta Vecchio and both my husband and I enjoyed our daily walk into the city centre itself. The hotel boasts to be One of The Worlds Leading Hotels, and whilst I am sure there are far better hotels, our stay was extremely pleasant I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Eternity

Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel!! My husband and I stayed here for three nights during a ten day visit through Italy. We were shown a fabulous room that had just been refurbished with stylish, modern amenities. The bathroom was huge in green and white marble. The room had a balcony which overlooked a lovely garden courtyard. Our daily breakfast buffet was excellent and the service was attentive and professional. I'm not sure if the older rooms are as nice, but I would not hesitate to stay here again if I were given the same room. It was a slight walk to the main shopping area of town, but we enjoyed the walk. Don't let the first impression by the train station scare you. The neighborhood changes quickly and this hotel was first class.
Reviews.Author: NorthwestHikerbiker

Reviews.Content: Best of the Best Our stay for three nights was wonderful. We stayed at two other 5 star hotels during our trip to Italy and this was my favorite. The room with a balcony overlooking the pool was just recently rennovated. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There restaurant recommandations were superb. It is not directly in the center of the city but only a few minutes walk to everything. Only a few block from the train station and two blocks from the Arno River. The breakfast that was included was awesome.
Reviews.Author: penny1953

Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at Villa Medici Very nice hotel. We got a great rate directly on the LHW website--for the price we got, it was a very good value. I suspect the rates are higher in the spring and summer. When we arrived, they immediately upgraded us (without out asking) to a very large room with a balcony overlooking a small garden. We also received a nice welcome fruit basket. The room was immaculate and the bathroom quite large and immaculate also. This is an extremely quiet hotel and quite european. I would have loved to have used the pool, but it was too cool this time of the year. The hotel lobby is much larger than most european hotels and very nice. Breakfast was very nice also. If you don't have a lot of luggage, you can walk to this hotel from the train station (3-4 blocks).
Reviews.Author: lvm1

Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel and Staff My husband and I just returned from a 3 night weekend break at the Grand Hotel Villa Medici. I had booked the room on expedia and did not know what to expect, given the mixed reviews on this site and the amazing (almost too good to be true) price! I could not have been more pleasantly surprised. We were greeted, whisked through check-in, and shown to a huge room with a small balcony overlooking the pool. The room had modern decor, a flatscreen TV, sleek built in wardrobes/ closets, and an enormous bathroom with excellent power shower. The concierge took care of our every need, booking us in to 3 excellent restaurants each night that perfectly fulfilled our requests (one night we said romantic and got a restaurant right on the river overlooking the Ponte Vecchio). He also booked us at the last minute on a small group tour to Siena and San Gimingano. For the price, the Grand Hotel Villa Medici exceeded our every expectation of room, service, and value.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a leading hotel of the world My husband and I stayed one night at the Villa Medici and had high expectations knowing it is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World and ranking itself as a 5 star deluxe hotel on their webpage.We arrived in the evening and was immediately greeted by the porter who took our suitcase and cabin sized luggage and then started to roll them across the pavement and continued rolling them on the stairs leading up to the reception in such way I thought the weels were going to come off! The luggage was not particularily heavy and had we known it was such a struggle we would have been happy to carry them ourselves! Once we arrived at the reception the porter just dropped the luggage with such roughness that even the receptionist raised an eyebrow.The lobby area is grand and impressive and the check-in and check-out was accurate and speedy and we were shown to our room. The room was very large with a large king size bed which was unfortunately a bit too hard (and I am not the fussy type of person). There was only one pillow for each person and it too was hard and too high (no choice of pillows at this 5 star hotel...)The bathroom was small and very dated and in need of prompt renovation. Crack in the sink and a toilet so old that it had turned from white to yellow color on the plastic parts. The bathtub enamel was heavily stained from water. There was no power in the shower which meant it took ages to take a quick shower. The bathroom floor hadn't been cleaned properly - there was a broken hairpin perfectly visible.We arrived just in time for dinner at the hotel restaurant before closing and the service was excellent and so was the food. The Florentine steak is probably the best in town. Breakfast was standard Italian and nothing to get too excited about - the scrambled eggs were awful!I think that the Leading Hotels of the World needs to take a closer look at their member hotels. This is the 2nd time I have been disappointed at a LHW hotel and can no longer trust the quality of their hotel members. The Villa Medici seems to be living on its old reputation of a deluxe hotel and for this reason they completely overcharge for their rooms. You would be better off staying at a BB and pay 1/5 of the price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel My wife and I stayed it this delightful hotel located about three blocks from the train station. It is with in a comfortable walking distance, from the train station, even if your wife overpacks like mine. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was very large, well appointed and had a beautiful balcony with a great view of downtown. It has been reported that this is a hotel that appeals to Europeans more than Americans, but we Americans had a fantastic time at the Medici.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Villa Medici is fine My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The Grand Hotel Villa Medici was fine, but didn't really impress me the way our hotels in Venice and Salzburg did. The decor suited the time period and was pleasant, but it could have been maintained a bit better. The room was nice enough, but the second my husband got in the room, his allergies kicked up. I don't know if it was dust or mold, but he had to live on Actifed whenever we were in our room.The fitness center was okay, but very small and not very attractive. Although, it was an adventure gettting down there - I felt I was decending to a dungeoun or something.The hotel staff was great. I really can't say a cross thing about the staff. All were very professional and attentive. I especially like the concierge and front desk staff.We booked the hotel through American Express Platinum card services. We didn't really get much of an upgrade like we did in other hotels. Also, the gift was less impressive than the other hotels (a fruit plate). We enjoyed our meals here including a gourmet dinner (we were alone in the restaurant), 3 breakfasts (all very nice, but had to wait on coffee each time), and a sandwich in the bar. I really think the hotel was nice, but after our 5 previous nights in 2 other wonderful hotels, it was just a bit short. And it just didn't seem to befit the title leading hotel of the world as it is supposed to be.
Reviews.Author: dhemmert

Reviews.Content: Great staff Recently spent a long weekend at this hotel. It's a short walk (10 mins) from the station and the centre of town, but that's a good thing in our book. Less noise and restaurants where the locals eat. Room was very nice, clean and quiet. The thing that stood out were the staff and especially both concierges. They proved extremely helpful in getting tickets for an event that was totally sold out. We'd definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Flaherty99

Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Villa Medici -- A Gem in the Heart of Florence My fifteen year old daughter and I spent seven nights at the Grand Hotel Villa Medici during the first week of July 2005, the second leg of our annual 'Mother-Daughter summer holiday. A former palazzo converted to a luxury hotel, the Grand Hotel Villa Medici is an absolute gem in the heart of Florence. The staff was warm and welcoming, and our room was HUGE, clean, and tastefully decorated. Fresh fruit and flowers were placed in our room daily, and the beautiful walled garden -- with the only swimming pool in the city of Florence -- provided a lovely afternoon respite after a day of hot summer sightseeing. The hotel enjoys a terrific location and is within walking distance of the Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi Palace Museum, the Academy of Art (where Michelangelo's David stands), the Boboli Gardens, the Duomo, and all the shopping and sightseeing spots you can imagine. It is also about three blocks from the train station and very close to the Arno River, great for an evening stroll. Everyone at the Hotel was courteous, friendly, and professional. The concierge staff greeted us by name each time we entered and exited the hotel, making us feel right at home. They also saved us countless hours of waiting in long lines by booking 'reserved' tickets for us at major sights and arranged a most memorable hot-air balloon/horseback riding adventure through the Tuscan countryside . We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel and would HIGHLY recommend the Grand Hotel Villa Medici to anyone who enjoys gracious service, exquisite accomodations, and a terrific location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Faultless We stayed at the GH Villa Medici for 4 nights as a reward to oursleves for managing 10 years of marriage. Our time there was faultless from start to finish; a clean and spacious room, excellent service and courteous staff, sumptous buffet breakfast, and really helpful concierges. And Florence was awesome too, get yourself to the top of the Duomo.Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Service My wife  I recently toured Northern Italy and our first stop was Florence. Upon entering the hotel you are treated as family. The service is 5 stars. The concierge, Paolo and the big guy (forgot his name), were extremely helpful and make the stay that much better. They recommended excellent restaurants  helped with directions all over N. Italy. The pool is a major plus in the summer time - the temp was over 90 degrees and after a long day of touring you need to relax and sit out/lay out. No other hotel in the center has this feature  I personally thought it was well worth it. There are some flaws with this hotel. #1 - They are currently undergoing a major renovation and if you like to sleep past 8 - it ins't going to happen. If you rise early no worries. No work is done on the weekends. #2 - The rooms (unrenovated) are in outdated and somewhat shabby. We asked to be upgraded  they showed us a different room but we were already unpacked. If you don't like your room complain and they will upgrade you. I would definitely return on service alone if it was the summertime.
Reviews.Author: OBVIOUSNYC

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! We stayed here on a deal we got through Orbitz, which got us a fabulous 2-bathroom suite for the same price as hotels in the main tourist zone were asking for small single rooms. Upon arrival, the concierge walked us to our room, and 10 minutes later we received a complimentary bottle of good champagne and snacks - what a pleasant surprise!The front desk staff remembers you and your room number, and are unfailingly helpful. The concierge can get you reservations at the Uffizi or the Accademia, which you will need to have to avoid waiting in line for 3 hours during high season.The hotel is a little bit of a hike from the main tourist area, but that's a good thing. Once you get out of the main tourist zone near Il Duomo, you get a much more authentic Florentine experience. Plus, prices subside quickly. So, you can find a much better place to eat between the hotel  the main tourist area than you would, say, at Piazza della Republica. The extra walking will help you burn those calories from dinner.Speaking of dinner, the food at the hotel is fantastic. The assorted cheese plate is wonderful, but bear in mind that in Italy the assorted cheese plate is not a small sampling of cheese like in the U.S., but half a pound or more of good Italian cheese. It's a meal in itself!I'd definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: ReluctantPeninsulan

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with very helpful staff My wife and I spent 3 nights at this beautiful hotel earlier this month. Our room was very nice - overlooking a magnificent swimming pool. This was surprising for a city hotel. The hotel is well located, about 10-15 minutes walk to the museums and attractions. The outside restaurant close by the pool served excellent food, but the atmosphere was affected by kids splashing and playing in the pool at 9:00 pm.My wife's suitcase did not arrive when we flew to Rome from the U.S. and we drove to the hotel in Florence without it. The hotel desk staff was both friendly and very helpful to us in attempting to retrieve the suitcase. One of the staff, Big Martino, actually drove us to the Florence airport to search for the suitcase and returned on his own to continue the search.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: An Outstanding Hotel My wife  I and several friends visited the Villa Medici in May. It was a most pleasant experience. I had a large , well-appointed room with balconey overlooking the garden. The room was immaculate.  The breakfast buffet was outstanding! The food in the restaurant adjoining the garden was excellent. The hotel staff was most helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Exactly What We Were Looking For!!! After looking through hundreds of hotels and reviews, this was the one that caught our attention and we were glad we made that choice! The hotel is situated close to town so you will hear the traffic, but mostly during the day if you are outside or have your room door or window open. It is close to everything, so the location was key!The accomodations were much nicer than we expected (very clean and well maintained) and the pool area was a nice welcome back after tours and shopping all day. The conceirge team was absolutely wonderful and extremely helpful in helping you plan out your days. They are very friendly and fun to talk to.If you are interested in seeing the Chianti Region and visiting the wine vineyards, ask Martino, who is one of the concierges, about a tour with his company which will bring you to many other places that a bus tour could not. We spent an entire day with a personal tour guide which ended up being the best day we spent in Florence.The Villa Medici was truly a wonderful place to stay, the entire staff was over accomodating and extremely friendly. We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Florence!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Great Room Contrary to the previous two reviews we had a fantastic stay at this hotel. It was the final stop of our honeymoon  we really couldn't have been made to feel more welcome.As well as a complimentary bowl of fruit, other food  wine being presented to us to help celebrate, we were upgraded to a great room with a huge rooftop terrace overlooking Florence. The room itself was not huge but perfectly adequate (the bed was massive  everything very clean).The hotel staff were excellent, friendly  were always happy to provide reccomendations for restaurants, make bookings for us etc. The only hiccup was when our door lock broke  locked us out of our room, but even then, within 5 minutes 3 engineers appeared to fix things followed by a call from the manager to apologise  make sure everything had been resolved for us.The 10 minute walk to the centre of Florence may be an issue for some but it's just a quick taxi ride or nice stroll along the river (when it's not too hot), so not a problem as long as you're aware of it beforehand.
Reviews.Author: DuffyMoon88

Reviews.Content: disappointing to say the least on a tour of europe summer of 2005. after staying at 5 star properties in london, paris and venice we expected the same from our choice in florence. immediately upon checkin it was apparant the quality and maintenance of the property were not up the same standards we had experienced in the other cities. the lobby was dirty, dusty and just had an overall shabby appearance. every piece of glass was smudged and dirty. when taken to our rooms they were the same or worse. all were dusty to the point of making us sneeze. the furnishings were beat up. the decor was just plain ugly. we asked to see better rooms and were taken to rooms that were no better. we began making other arrangements with our tour agency. once the manager discovered this he took us to other rooms again. this time apparantly they were special rooms. we accepted but continued our search. we found a different hotel and checked out the following morning. the one evening we did spend there we spent some time in the pool area. it is lovely and well maintained. from there we could see what appeared to be a newer wing with what appeared to be very nice rooms that were most likely remodeled. i suspect this hotel has not completed its renovation and has a mediocre cleaning staff. i would never recommend it as i am very particular about where i stay. especially if i am paying for five star status
Reviews.Author: ArkansasSmf

Reviews.Content: Very overrated I was expecting big things after reading all the reviews of Grand Hotel Villa Medici and was very dissapointed. As some others have indicated, the location is not great. It's a decent 15 minute hike to the sites. I had a single room and the bed was the smallest I've ever seen. No hotel in the United States would ever provide a bed this small. Also, if you have a room facing the street, you'll hear traffic all night long. For the amount of money I spent, I'm sure I could have found a better hotel. Also, the concierges were not very helpful. I wanted recommendations of vineyards in Chianti to visit and all they would give me was a brochure from one vineyard.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: All of the best This is a lovely hotel. It's a bit away from things, but that's part of it's charm. The staff is wonderful, very helpful and warm. The restaurant is very good with some rather creative dishes. The bar next to it is very comfortable and has a pianist with an unusually eclectic repetrore. Rooms are rather large fand quiet for Europe and some have a viewn of the river. Despite it's charm, it is also up to date with well equipped bathrooms and internet access via the television. Trust the concierges. They'll take great care of you.
Reviews.Author: dolphoto

Reviews.Content: Luxury What an excellent hotel. Staff who remember you whenever you come to the desk. Great buffet breakfast. Quiet position about 1.5 km from centre but a nice walk if you take the riverside. Large rooms, and bathrooms to relax in. Expensive but worth it for yourself.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Discrete elegant and great staff This is a great hotel; stylish, relaxed and thoughtful. The staff on the reception desk were amongst the best I have ever dealt with. Polite, helpful and cheerful. Well done
